para.para: Header file for micrograph processing.

listitem.para: Bfield * field_find_id (Bfield *field, Bstring &field_id)
Finds a field-of-view based on its identifier.

Returns a pointer to a specific micrograph in a field-of-view structure based on a unique characteristic of that micrograph.

Returns a pointer to the nth micrograph in a field-of-view structure.

Finds the micrograph closest to a zero degree tilt in a series.

Finds the micrograph closest to a zero degree tilt in a series with markers.

section.title: Detailed Description
section.para: Header file for micrograph processing.

formalpara.title: Author
formalpara.para: Bernard Heymann

formalpara.title: Date
formalpara.para: Created: 20000426
Modified: 20210515

section.title: field_count()

para.para: Counts the number of fields-of-view in a linked list.

literallayout.computeroutput: The function counts fields-of-view in the list from the given pointer, and does not count fields-of-view prior to this one.

entry.para: pointer to any field-of-view in the list.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: long number of fields-of-view.

section.title: field_find_id()

para.para: Finds a field-of-view based on its identifier.

entry.para: pointer to first field-of-view in the list.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: Bfield* field-of-view or NULL if not found. The function searches a linked list for the field-of-view identifier and returns a pointer to that structure or NULL if it cannot find it.

section.para: Definition at line 33 of file mg_select.cpp.

section.title: field_find_low_tilt_mg_with_markers()

para.para: Finds the micrograph closest to a zero degree tilt in a series with markers.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: Bmicrograph* micrograph closest to zero degrees tilt with markers. The first micrograph with the smallest deviation from zero degree tilt with defined markers is returned.

section.para: Definition at line 312 of file mg_select.cpp.

section.title: field_find_micrograph()

para.computeroutput: Bmicrograph* field_find_micrograph (Bfield * field, int mg_select, int mg_index, double mg_ang)

para.para: Returns a pointer to a specific micrograph in a field-of-view structure based on a unique characteristic of that micrograph.

formalpara.title: Author
formalpara.para: David Belnap

entry.para: Reference by its index in field (for mg_ref_select=0|1|2).
Reference by micrograph rotation or tilt angle (for mg_ref_select=3|4).

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para:
Bmicrograph* Pointer to the selected micrograph Calls functions that find a micrograph by index number within the field, by focus level, in-plane rotational angle, tilt angle, or tilt angle plus focus level or index number:
criterion mg_select mg_index mg_ang -------------------------------------------------------------- nth closest-to-focus 0 n - nth farthest-from-focus 1 n - index number in series (1...n) 2 index - in-plane rotation angle 3 - angle tilt angle 4 - angle

section.para: Definition at line 64 of file mg_select.cpp.

section.title: field_find_micrograph_by_focus()

para.computeroutput: Bmicrograph* field_find_micrograph_by_focus (Bfield * field, int focus_opt, int iselect)

para.para: Returns a pointer to the micrograph in a field-of-view structure based on the focus level and iteration index.

formalpara.title: Author
formalpara.para: David Belnap and Bernard Heymann

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: Bmicrograph* mg Micrograph at specified focus level Loops through micrographs in the field-of-view. Orders focus values in an array from smallest to largest. Selects the (index+1)th closest-to-focus or farthest-from-focus value. (focus_opt determines whether the closest or farthest value is selected.) Loops through micrographs again to find the micrograph with the selected value. Tests if there are zero or multiple micrographs with the same focus value and exits program if so. Otherwise, the pointer to the micrograph with the specified focus level is returned. An example, if index=1 and focus_opt=0, a pointer to the 2nd closest-to-focus micrograph will be returned. To get the closest-to-focus or farthest-from-focus value, the index must be zero.

section.para: Definition at line 142 of file mg_select.cpp.

section.title: field_find_micrograph_by_rotang()

para.para: Returns a pointer to the micrograph in a field-of-view structure with the specified in-plane rotational angle.

formalpara.title: Author
formalpara.para: David Belnap and Bernard Heymann

entry.para: in-plane rotational angle of micrograph (in radians)

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: Bmicrograph* mg Pointer to micrograph with rotang Loop through all micrographs in the field-of-view to find micrograph with the specified angle. Test if there are zero or multiple micrographs with the same rotational angle, halt program if true. If not true, then return pointer to the micrograph with the specified angle.

section.para: Definition at line 199 of file mg_select.cpp.

section.title: field_find_micrograph_by_tiltang()

para.para: Returns a pointer to the micrograph in a field-of-view structure with the specified tilt angle.

formalpara.title: Author
formalpara.para: David Belnap

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: Bmicrograph* micrograph with rotang Loop through all micrographs in the field-of-view to find micrograph with the specified tilt angle. Test if there are zero or multiple micrographs with the same angle, halt program if true. If not true, then return pointer to the micrograph with the specified angle.

section.para: Definition at line 243 of file mg_select.cpp.

section.title: field_find_micrograph_n()

para.para: Returns a pointer to the nth micrograph in a field-of-view structure.

formalpara.title: Author
formalpara.para: David Belnap and Bernard Heymann

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: Bmicrograph* Pointer to the nth micrograph Loop through micrographs in the field-of-view until the nth micrograph is reached. Return pointer to that micrograph. Tests whether n is within the appropriate range.

section.title: field_find_zero_tilt_mg()

para.para: Finds the micrograph closest to a zero degree tilt in a series.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: Bmicrograph* micrograph closest to zero degrees tilt. The first micrograph with the smallest deviation from zero degree tilt is returned.
